title: (x) "Multimedia" brush script - Lamplighter Script {Paul DH}
content:
Can anybody recognize this font?

Tnx...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323040717/http:/typophile.com/files/Font_3.jpg) | 40.47 KB |
author: super_mrki

comments.content:
I'm pretty convinced that this is not a font, although it's hard to prove when the only duplicated letter is an 'i'. However, I think you could get a somewhat similar feel from [Sign DNA's 'Chicago Style'](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323040717/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg9.html), or even [Adobe Caflisch Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323040717/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ADT0002937).

Some of House's painter scripts, and their 'Fabulous', as well as a couple of Jason Walcott's scripts (Jukebox Foundry at Veer.com) might also be close enough substitutes.

- Mike Yanega

it's [Lamplighter Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323040717/http:/fontdiner.com/menu_vegas.html) by [Font Diner](http://web.archive.org/web/20100323040717/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Font%2520Diner). Surprised you didn't come up with that one, Mike!

Thanks for the ID Paul. There's script fonts for me to learn all the time. That's one I need to add to the Guide, if I can get a sample of it. You wouldn't want to make a sample would you?

- Mike Yanega
